posts.name: Aburiya Raku
posts.note: From their website, 'Aburiya Raku is a cozy room that is packed with foodies for their creative Japanese small plates, plus a bustling late-night scene. &ldqou;Aburiya Raku&rdqou; means &ldqou;Charcoal Grill House Enjoyment&rdqou;, we would like you to enjoy our authentic Japanese food. Our goal is to see your smile. The owner-chef, Mitsuo Endo, was born in Tokyo in 1971. He became an apprentice chef in 1988 and learned Kaiseki: Japanese traditional course style cuisine, at prestigious kaiseki restaurants in Tokyo. When he was thirty, he decided to move to the United States to make his dream come true. The first restaurant he opened as a head chef was in Seattle in 2001. Next year, he put himself in the more challenging city, New York. In 2002, Endo met his mentor Koji Imai who taught him the quintessence of food, and he joined for opening MEGU Tribeca and Midtown as an executive chef. In 2007, he moved to Las Vegas to seek new challenges and opened EN as a head chef. In 2008, he opened his own restaurant, &ldqou;Aburiya Raku&rdqou;.'

posts.name: China Poblano
posts.note: China Poblano is Chef José Andrés' inventive mix of Chinese and Mexican cuisines. We ordered a bunch of different things from Shrimp Mojo to lamb potstickers, along with 'When Pigs Fly' (Chinese barbecue pork steamed buns) and a few other things.

posts.name: Fat Choy Restaurant
posts.note: Fat Choy Restaurant is a modern diner at the Eureka Casino, turning out clever takes on American and Asian comfort food. From their website, 'It all started when... we bought a 1977 food truck in 2010 and operated at the farmer's market and various food festivals, including President Obama's Las Vegas rally. The truck kept breaking down again and again. Eventually, we found a small cafe for rent on the corner of Tropicana and Decatur....in a hair salon. We had an auspicious meeting with the owner of Eureka Casino in 2012. Upon the first meeting, the concept for Fat Choy was born. Fat Choy is a Classic American Diner with a twist on Asian Comfort Foods, where a cheeseburger or a plate of Buffalo Wings can share the same table with a bowl of wonton soup or some delicious tangy sesame noodles.'

posts.name: Flock and Fowl
posts.note: Flock and Fowl has a small kitchen that serves up a compact Chinese menu with a focus on free-range chicken. From their website, 'Flock and Fowl was born in 2015 from our obsession of serving you the perfect plate of chicken rice. We only cook what we would serve our own family. We believe what you eat should be natural, pure, and fresh. We make all of our own sauces in house, including two different soy sauces for your eating pleasure. We do not use MSG. We source only the best produce and use organic ingredients as much as possible.'

posts.name: Forte Tapas
posts.note: Forte Tapas is a casual, cozy eatery with small Spanish plates and Eastern European comfort food. A quote from their website: 'The unique culinary dynamic and the soul of Forte stems from rich travel experiences and immersing ourselves in the cuisine of Europe. Through these experiences, we are able to find our passion for food. Taking inspiration from the rich cuisine of my home country, haute cuisine, and most importantly, my family’s traditions and zest for life all have contributed to Forte’s unique culinary dynamic. Forte was inspired by a love for connecting with people through food, drink and hospitality and the insatiable desire to create something that has never been done before.'

posts.name: Fuku Burger
posts.note: Fuku Burger is a sleek counter-serve spot offering burgers with Japanese flavors in a colorful indoor-outdoor space.

posts.name: John Mull's Road Kill Grill - BBQ
posts.note: John Mull's Road Kill Grill us an unfussy BBQ joint with covered outdoor seating offering Southern-style smoked meats and country sides. You wouldn't expect to find an awesome BBQ joint in the middle of a neighborhood. You can wait over an hour on a good day to get your food. I ordered the hot link and brisket with two sides. NOTE: Don't forget they close at 6 PM.

posts.name: KoMex Fusion Express
posts.note: KoMex Fusion Express is an Asian-fusion eatery offering tacos, burritos, and other dishes made with Korean and Mexican ingredients. From the Eater Las Vegas website, 'The restaurant got its start after the family started combining meats from their Korean meat market with Mexican flavors. Fusion tacos, burritos, chimichangas, flautas, and more are the specialty here.'

posts.name: Lotus of Siam
posts.note: Lotus of Siam is a revered, owner-operated Thai eatery in Commercial Center offering family recipes and a vast wine list. NOTE: Order from Northern Thai section of the menu it's what they are known for, and it's their specialty.

posts.name: Mian Sichuan Noodles
posts.note: From Las Vegas Eater website, 'Mian Sichuan Noodles has very quietly debuted on Spring Mountain. Launched last year in Alhambra, California, by chef Tony Xu, the Mian concept is built around a menu of zhajiangmian-style noodles, found in the Chinese city of Chongqing and located 167 miles from Chengdu, the source for his earlier great success.'

posts.name: Naked City Pizza Shop
posts.note: Naked City Pizza Shop is a no-frills eatery serving up Buffalo chicken wings, hearty subs, and specialty pizzas made from scratch. They serve Buffalo style square pizza. A quote from their website: 'We are two brothers from Buffalo, New York. Along with support from our father, wife, girlfriend, friends, and extended family has created Naked City Pizza. Our family works each day in our restaurants to handcraft as many ingredients as possible. We honor our roots and family upbringing, while we are also trying to create and innovate on a daily basis.'

posts.name: Omelet House
posts.note: Omelet House is a local fixture for jumbo omelets, other breakfast, lunch, and diner fare in a family-friendly setting.

posts.name: Peppermill Fireside Lounge
posts.note: Peppermill Fireside Lounge is a neon-lit lounge with romantic booths, fruity cocktails, elegant servers, and flaming reflection pool. From their website, 'A timeless must-visit stop on the Las Vegas strip! The Peppermill Restaurant and Lounge is a classic with a cool atmosphere, unique drinks, and amazing food and desserts! Come see why the Peppermill has been featured in numerous movies!'

posts.name: Raku
posts.note: Raku is in a cozy room which packs food lovers with creative Japanese small plates, plus a bustling late-night scene. Order some of the izakaya and yakitori dishes along with the fresh tofu with smoked hot sauce.

posts.name: Ronald's Donuts
posts.note: From the Las Vegas Eater website, about Ronald's Donuts, 'This stalwart of the doughnut world goes old school with choices such as maple bars, glazed, custard-filled, jelly, cinnamon twists, cinnamon rolls, and apple fritters. Nab a bag of doughnut holes as well. Be sure to ask which varieties are vegan if that suits your diet. Cash only.' Penn Jillette recommends the vegan raspberry-filled jelly donut, along with the apple or raspberry turnover, apple fritter, and the plain glazed.

posts.name: Shang Artisan Noodle
posts.note: Shang Artisan Noodle is a modern, compact spot with an open kitchen serving hand-pulled noodles, and Chinese small plates. From their website, 'Shang Artisan Noodle aims to both honor and elevate the Chinese culinary tradition of handmade noodles. With an emphasis on high-quality ingredients, classic techniques, and thoughtful presentations, we want to delight our guests with an affordable meal that satisfies all of their senses. (Just because we are a fast-casual concept doesn’t mean we can’t offer an exceptional experience.) Our concept may be rooted in the past, but our execution embraces contemporary tastes.'

posts.name: Tacos El Gordo
posts.note: Tacos El Gordo has a passion for delivering great-tasting Mexican Tacos. We have been in the food service industry for over 40 years, opening our first restaurant in 1972. You need to try all the odd cuts of meat such as tripe, Lengua (tongue), and seso (brains). The tacos are small, so you can order a half dozen and still be hungry. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Yardbird Southern Table and Bar
posts.note: Yardbird Southern Table and Bar is a traditional Southern eatery with themed decor, chicken, and waffles, grits and more, plus craft cocktails. You need to order the deviled eggs and the shrimp and grits. NOTE: They have other locations around the United States.
